channel.title: Shortcodes on DocDock Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Shortcodes on DocDock Documentation

item.title: alert
attachments
item.description: The Attachments shortcode displays a list of files attached to a page. Example : <li> <a href="//shortcodes/attachments.files/BachGavotteShort.mp3" > BachGavotteShort.mp3 </a> (357 kB) </li> <li> <a href="//shortcodes/attachments.files/Carroll_AliceAuPaysDesMerveilles.pdf" > Carroll_AliceAuPaysDesMerveilles.pdf </a> (175 kB) </li> <li> <a href="//shortcodes/attachments.files/adivorciarsetoca00cape.pdf" > adivorciarsetoca00cape.pdf </a> (361 kB) </li> <li> <a href="//shortcodes/attachments.files/hugo.png" > hugo.png </a> (17 kB) </li> <li> <a href="//shortcodes/attachments.files/movieselectricsheep-flock-244-32500-2.mp4" > movieselectricsheep-flock-244-32500-2.mp4 </a> (340 kB) </li> Usage The shortcurt lists files found in a specific folder.

item.title: button
item.description: Display an actionable button in your page. This is a warning button Usage Parameter Default Description href "” The location href to link to align “center” horizontal align button on page theme primary default, primary , success,info,warning,danger The inner text you place in short code will be displayed as the button text Demo {{< button href="https://google.

item.title: excerpt
item.description: The Excerpt shortcode is used to mark a part of a page’s content for re-use. Defining an excerpt enables other shortcodes, such as the excerpt-include shortcode, to display the marked content elsewhere. You can only define one excerpt per page. In other words, you can only add the Excerpt shortcode once to a page. Usage Parameter Default Description hidden “false” Controls whether the page content contained in the Excerpt shortcode placeholder is displayed on the page.

item.title: excerpt-include
item.description: The Excerpt Include shortcode is used to display ‘excerpted’ (that is, a segment of) content from one page in another. Before you can use this shortcode, the excerpt must have been defined using the Excerpt shortcode. Note that you can have more than one Excerpt Include shortcode on a page (although you can have only one Excerpt shortcode on a page). Usage Parameter Default Description filename required Type the filename of the page that contains the excerpt to be displayed.

item.title: expand
item.description: The Expand shortcode displays an expandable/collapsible section of text on your page. Here is an example Expand me... </span> </div> <div class="expand-content" style="display: none;"> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur.

item.title: icon
mermaid
item.description: Flowchart example Show code ... </span> </div> <div class="expand-content" style="display: none;"> {{<mermaid align="left">}} graph LR; A[Hard edge] -->|Link text| B(Round edge) B --> C{Decision} C -->|One| D[Result one] C -->|Two| E[Result two] {{< /mermaid >}} </div> mermaid.initialize({startOnLoad:true}); graph LR; A[Hard edge] --|Link text| B(Round edge) B -- C{Decision} C --|One| D[Result one] C --|Two| E[Result two] With sub-graphs and some style Show code... </span> </div> <div class="expand-content" style="display: none;"> {{<mermaid align="left">}} graph LR; X --> Y linkStyle 0 stroke:#f00,stroke-width:4px; Y --> Z Z --> X linkStyle 1,2 interpolate basis stroke:#0f0,stroke-width:2px; X --> A1 subgraph right A2 --> B2 B2 --> C2 end subgraph left A1 --> B1 B1 --> C1 end C1 --> X Z --> A2 C2 --> Z style Y fill:#f9f,stroke:#333,stroke-width:4px classDef left fill:#ccf,stroke:#f66,stroke-width:2px,stroke-dasharray: 5, 5 class A1,B1,C1 left {{< /mermaid >}} </div> mermaid.

item.title: notice
item.description: The notice shortcode shows 4 types of disclaimers to help you structure your page. Note {{% notice note %}} A notice disclaimer {{% /notice %}} renders as Info {{% notice info %}} An information disclaimer {{% /notice %}} renders as Tip {{% notice tip %}} A tip disclaimer {{% /notice %}} renders as Warning {{% notice warning %}} An warning disclaimer {{% /notice %}} renders as

item.title: panel
item.description: The panel shortcodeAllow you to highlight information or put it in a box. They create a colored box surrounding your text Usage Parameter Default Description header none The title of the panel. If specified, this title will be displayed in its own header row. footer none the footer of the panel. If specified, this text will be displayed in its own row theme primary default,primary,info,success,warning,danger Basic example By default :

item.title: revealjs
item.description: This shortcode will format the enclosed markdow to render it with reveal.js at runtime (client-side) Read more on revealjs github repo. Usage revealjs can use the following named parameters : theme transition controls progress history center Content formating and slide delimiters read more on this here Demo # In the morning ___ ## Getting up - Turn off alarm - Get out of bed ___ ## Breakfast - Eat eggs - Drink coffee --- # In the evening ___ ## Dinner - Eat spaghetti - Drink wine ___ ## Going to sleep - Get in bed - Count sheep function initSlides() { Reveal.
